fields.description:
Fisheye 3.1
JIRA 6.0.8
Fisheye plugin 6.0.2

When I perform a smart commit the change shows up in the activity log for a given ticket but does not adjust time, insert comments or modify the issue.  I am thinking this might be a permissions issue because I am connecting to the VisualSVN server via active directory but I am using Jira users for everything else.

Please help.
fields.summary: Smart Commits - Not logging time

fields.summary: Disabling JIRA Integration Plugin breaks search, activity page scroll, and introduces navigation artifact

fields.description:
FishEye does its best to detect a non-JIRA 5.0+ instance on upgrade and should disable the new JIRA Integration plugin for your FishEye instance.  The old behavior of providing links straight through to the JIRA issue should then work as before.

The problem is that on restart the plugin always is re-enabled. 

*WORKAROUND*
You can disable this plugin manually via the FishEye admin screen: Manage Add-ons --> Show System Add-ons --> JIRA Integration :: plugin --> Disable.
fields.summary: JIRA Integration Plugin fails to remain disabled

fields.summary: Error while indexing the repository

fields.description:
When users attempts to add repository to FishEye with a name of repository already defined, there is error message presented as expected.
But it only works if repository name was in the same case, see
!case1.png|thumbnail!

If user provided conflicting repository name in different case, cryptic 500 error is displayed instead:
!case2.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
* Always specify a non-existing name when adding a repository.
fields.summary: 500 error when adding repository to FishEye of conflicting name in different case
SVN repositories showing up as indexing in quicksearch even if they aren't

fields.description:
When generating a line graph for a svn repository, if I choose to further breakdown the chart based on the provided options (sundirectory, author, user, extension), the option jumps back to "None" after I hit "Apply", though the chart does change to reflect the selected options.
The desired behaviour should keep the previous breakdown option instead of defaulting it to "None".
fields.summary: Line chart options jump back to "None" after "Apply"

fields.description:
Hello,
our company is running FeCru (version 2.9.1) for a long time, but last week began the problems - exceptions/errors like

org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection

are thrown and FeCru is not fuinctional. After restart, the FeCru is running for 1-2 hours, after this period errors occur again. 

The error is similar to bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-6385
No changes in config of FeCru nor server were made. 

We had stopped the maintenance some months ago, because of looking for and trying another reposotory-management sw (maybe Stash), but we have a FeCru in production still.

Could you help, please?
fields.summary: FeCru: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection

fields.summary: Display the repository type when listing all repositories through the REST API

fields.description:
I have FishEye running on default ports with Apache configured as follows:

<VirtualHost 10.1.1.25:80>
    ServerName fisheye.mydomain.net

    ProxyRequests Off
    ProxyPreserveHost On

    <Proxy *>
        Order deny,allow
        Allow from all
    </Proxy>

    ProxyPass / http://127.0.0.1:8060/
    ProxyPassReverse / http://127.0.0.1:8060/

    <Location />
        Order allow,deny
        Allow from all
    </Location>
</VirtualHost>

When I attempt to setup the Application Link from JIRA to FishEye using "http://fisheye.mydomain.net" it doesn't recognise this as a FishEye instance. If I add the 8060 port to the end of the URL it detects that it is FishEye and the link work correctly.

I have Bamboo, JIRA & Confluence configured exactly the same way (using Apache) and the Application Links between them work perfectly. The link from Bamboo to FishEye using "http://fisheye.mydomain.net" works fine without adding the port.

Not sure if this is a bug with JIRA or FishEye, I don't understand how it could be a local configuration issue as all other links work correctly, including the link between Bamboo and FishEye. It appears to be a specific issue connecting JIRA with FishEye.
fields.summary: FishEye Application Link Setup from JIRA doesn't work when using proxy

fields.description:
The GitHub service for FishEye seems to be sending a wrong Content-Type, preventing it from working:

{code}
POST /rest-service-fecru/admin/repositories-v1/fe-gh-testrepo/scan HTTP/1.1
Host: HOSTNAME
Accept: */*
User-Agent: GitHub Hookshot bbde025
X-Api-Key: APIKEY
Content-Length: 0
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
{code}

Should be application/json.
fields.summary: GitHub service sends wrong content-type, preventing it from working

fields.summary: Smart commits configuration fails on Oracle

fields.description:
This button is greyed out and serves no purpose. Please remove this button. 

Alternatively, create the functionality such that a click of the button will save the configuration and will trigger a restart of the application.

!2013-09-13_1759.png!

*Workaround*

*Note*: If you are editing database settings to use an existing database ensure you are using a version of the application compatible with the database schema version.
*Note 2*: In order to have data and configuration from another instance in a new instance, prefer to follow the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Backing+up+and+restoring+FishEye+data] document instead of just editing the database settings.

Steps:
# Stop FishEye/Crucible.
# Open your config.xml located in your {{<FISHEYE_INST>}} directory.
# Identify the database configuration XML element and edit the attributes as required (this example is for MySQL): 
{noformat}
<database type="mysql"><connection dialect="org.hibernate.dialect.MySQL5InnoDBDialect" driver="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver" jdbcurl="jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/fisheye340" password="password" username="grefosco" maxPoolSize="20" minPoolSize="5" driverSource="bundled"/><parameters>useUnicode=true
characterEncoding=UTF8
connectionCollation=UTF8_bin
</parameters></database>
{noformat}
# Start FishEye/Crucible.
fields.summary: Database configuration button labeled "Save" serves no purpose

fields.description:
the campaign repo is stuck on this error:
 Error

Repository paused - resuming in 86 seconds.

Repository paused due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: Unable to find repository location for 'file:///opt/svn/repos/campaign/cm_solution/trunk/cmlws/grails-app/views/layouts/main.gsp' in revision '4,994' org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: Unable to find repository location for 'file:///opt/svn/repos/campaign/cm_solution/trunk/cmlws/grails-app/views/layouts/main.gsp' in revision '4,994' org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: Unable to find repository location for 'file:///opt/svn/repos/campaign/cm_solution/trunk/cmlws/grails-app/views/layouts/main.gsp' in revision '4,994'

I am able to export the file via svn. So why can't Fisheye find it?

d:\subversion>svn export https://148.181.151.98/svn/campaign/cm_solution/trunk/cmlws/grails-app/views/layouts/ -r 4994
A    layouts

Exported revision 4994.

I also ran svn verify and it did not find any problems with 4994.

fields.summary: Error: Unable to find repository location

fields.description: It would be nice to have the option to authenticate with username/password for repositories when using SSH protocol (but without SSH key).
fields.summary: Username/Password Authentication For SSH

fields.description: Every couple of weeks the Fisheye web interface stops responding. I have to kill fisheye and restart it. I believe this problem is linked to the indexing of the CC repo. It has taken several weeks to index that repo and it appears to be stuck at 61%. I need to know why it wont finish indexing.
fields.summary: Fisheye web interface stops responding

fields.description:
Commit charts are generated in ajax requests, and don't seem to be cached properly.
As generating them might get expensive on a large repository we should investigate not regenerating them as often, potentially also changing the way we trigger the requests and perform the actual queries.
fields.summary: Commit chart rendering might affect performance

fields.description:
As a user I want to find all changesets/commit messages which belong to  feature branch

As many teams work using feature branches it would be a helpful to have easy way to find all the changes in feature branch.
fields.summary: Search by branch

fields.description: In the case of comments / replies a refresh of the page reveals that these items are persisted.
fields.summary: Ajax calls never return and eventually timeout with a 502 proxy error

fields.description:
It would be great to have a support.zip download link after generating the support files.

Some users are FishEye administrators, but have no access to FE server itself, so if they could download the support.zip it was going to make life easier.
fields.summary: Download link for support.zip

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA 6.0.3
# Install other applications(eg: FishEye 2.10.5)
# Integrate JIRA with the application successfully
# navigate to _JIRA Administrations > Application Navigator >_ and it will be empty

This is against the idea suggested by https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Links+in+the+Application+Navigator
{quote}
If applications are linked to your JIRA instance via application links, those applications will automatically appear in the application navigator. 
{quote}

Additional Notes:
* This problem is reproducible for JIRA 6.0.6 with FeCru 2.10.5.
* This problem is NOT seems to be reproducible for JIRA 6.0.6 with FeCru 3.1.1. The Application Navigator is added successfully after Application Link is configured.
fields.summary: Application Navigator Is Not Added Automatically After Creating Application Link

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Running+FishEye+as+a+Windows+service



The [wrapper.zip|https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/298976961/wrapper.zip?version=3&modificationDate=1367199979581&api=v2] unpacks these files outside of the wrapper directory:

- Fisheye-Control.bat
- Fisheye-Control.sh

The identical files are located in the /bin directory. 

Also, the service name is "Fisheye".
fields.summary: Clean up wrapper.zip

fields.description:
If we use in svn repository tag names with '/' eg. 'release/123' and index repository in Fisheye using default patterns for trunk/branches/tags then we will get "The requested resource cannot be found" error when browsing to tags/release/123.

Situation can be reproduced with svn repository from attached {{compound-tags.svn.zip}} file. After indexing repository it is enough to go to tags/czawadka/2 folder to get the error.
fields.summary: SVN repository error "The requested resource cannot be found" for tags with '/'

fields.description: In some cases where the excludes or includes in the svn repository completely exclude many changesets in a row (over 1000), later changesets might never transition to the 'done' state and not get their line counts filled in.
fields.summary: Some changesets never transition to 'done' when indexing a svn repository

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Download the backup (see private comment below for location).
- Download: fisheye-3.0.2
- Restore the backup: {noformat}fisheyectl.sh restore -t hsql -f fisheye_app_20130819.zip{noformat}
- Reset the administrator password by editing {{config.xml}}
-- admin-hash="21232F297A57A5A743894A0E4A801FC3"
- Start FishEye, note the context: http://localhost:8060/fisheye
- Log in as the application administrator: http://localhost:8060/fisheye/admin
- Create a built-in user.
- Log in and identify the Activity tab data.
- Delete repo01 from Administration.
- Shut down FishEye.
- Restore using the same instance.
- Identify the missing data in the Activity tab. 

h4. Workaround 
# Restore using a new instance.
OR
# Delete {{FISHEYE_INST/cache/globalfe}} before restoring the backup
fields.summary: Activity stream fails to restore on anything but a brand new instance

fields.description:
It is no longer possible to customise the FishEye/Crucible logo. 

I've tried changing the fecru.png and followed https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Customising+FishEye's+look+and+feel and it does not work.
fields.summary: Customize logo in FishEye Crucible

fields.description:
An SSH key pair identifies an entity connecting somewhere not an account it connects too. A single key pair is usually enough to connect to any number of accounts from a single work station. And this is the scenario GIT hosting is usually set up for.

FishEye requires SSH key set up for every git repository separately. If I have 100 repositories and use the recommended 'Generate key pair for ssh' option, I need to upload 100 ssh keys to my GIT host. And I need to upload another key each time I create a new repository. The only reasonable solution (except switching to HTTP) seems to be to create the keypair myself, upload the single public key to the GIT host and upload the keypair to FishEye every time a GIT repository is set up.  That is a workaround for a missing support for the very basic usage scenario. And it introduces maintenance problem of the keypair outside of FishEye.

Please add support for a 'global' SSH keypair for SSH authentication.
fields.summary: Support single SSH key for many GIT repositories

fields.description:
Fisheye can get into a state where it is requesting files from SVN that do not exist (and will 404)

This has been identified in 3 separate support cases but I haven't been able to investigate further.
fields.summary: Fisheye can get into a state where it is requesting files from SVN that do not exist (and will 404)

fields.description:
BackGround:

This appears new with the 3.1.x release.
1. Select a repository from the 'Repositories' tab.
2. Navigate using the 'tree view' on the left hand side (expand it if required).
3. Drill down into a sub-directory (expanding the tree).
4. Select a file to open it on the right.
The tree view is then reset - i.e. any opened folders are closed again, which is confusing to the user.
fields.summary: 'Tree view' resets when opening a file

fields.description:
In the [2.9 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+2.9+release+notes#FishEye2.9releasenotes-Otherannouncements] we need to add the [changes to the diff view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+2.9+release+notes#Crucible2.9releasenotes-Otherannouncements] mentioned in Crucible release notes.

As of FishEye 2.9 we're only showing 1 file at the time in the changeset view.
fields.summary: Amend FishEye 2.9 release notes to include the changes to the diff view

fields.description:
When changing FishEye/Crucible licenses quicksearch might show an error message "There was an error getting the search results. Please try again in a moment.".

The instance needs to be restarted to make the license changes take effect.
fields.summary: Quicksearch: license changes need a restart to be effective

fields.description:
Sometime "Broken Pipe" error might happen due to too many concurrent connection to FishEye/Crucible

Need a tool to monitor the concurrent connection.
fields.summary: Tool to monitor concurrent connection

fields.description:
Once a smart commits fail to run, there is no way to run it again.

Need an admin page showing the list of Smart Commits in the repository with the success or fail status so that we can run it again.

fields.description: *.proj Files of type "utf-16" show up as binary and can not be viewed or diffed. They should be shown as text.
fields.summary: *.proj Files of type "utf-16" show up as binary

fields.description:
Some operations appear to perform in O ( n ) time where n is the number of file revisions in a changeset.  This is a problem for huge changesets.

The two identified lookups are:
RevIdChangeSet.getReviewIds
FileRevisionDAO.countChangeSetRevisions

As a tactical fix, I'm going to stop counting / querying for reviews after 1000 revisions.  However we should really fix this properly.
fields.summary: Some operations required to render a changeset are linear time based on the number of file revisions in the changeset

fields.description:
Using J and K to navigate a changeset ignores my column preferences (I hide author and revision) but only for the diff line. This makes diffs impossible to navigate with the keyboard unless I show all columns by default.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: J and K changeset navigation is broken if all columns are not displayed

fields.description:
I've just upgraded from 2.8.0, and nowhere in any of the release notes did it mention that the "maximum files shown in a changeset" option has been removed, instead it always shows one file at a time.

Did I miss an option for this? There's still a "context lines" option in the profile settings, but with the one file at a time view it always displays a large context.

This greatly reduces the utility of Fisheye for me.
fields.summary: Missing multiple files shown in a changeset

fields.description:
Because Git does not associate a commit with a specific branch (i.e. a branch in git is just a pointer to an arbitrary point in a DAG) we have no way to know which branch a commit was initially made on.  Fisheye will show all the branches that a commit is present on, but the Jira Fisheye plugin only displays one branch.

This can be confusing because the branch displayed probably won't be a branch a user is expecting.  For git repos we should show the same thing as fisheye (BranchA, BranchB, and 3 more) or not show branch at all.

Stash commits displayed in JIRA do not display a branch.
fields.summary: Jira Fisheye plugin branch information is misleading for git repos

fields.description:
When synchronising users from JIRA/Crowd, fisheye makes one rest call for each user, including users for which it should not need to create locally because they are not in any groups that are being synchronised.

This means if a customer has 20000 users in their JIRA instance of which 50 are in a group that is synced to fisheye then 20000 requests will be made.  This is obviously not ideal.

There is probably a semi-valid reason for this (I have not investigated further) - possibly REST resources for which users are in a group are not available or are not suitable.  This should be investigated and fixed if possible.
fields.summary: User synchronisation with crowd can put a lot of unnecessary load on a JIRA/Crowd server

fields.description:
Currently merged-in branches all show as lots of lines under the heading of master. Rather than getting their own row.  

Very hard to figure out whats happened :(

fields.description: For some reason we don't get these in GIT.  We used to for hg. It makes it very hard to get a source of truth from FE.

IE10 is available in Windows 8 as of August 2012 (see http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2718695)

Bamboo has a repo management page that is very useful - if you take the same concept for repo credentials, it would enhance the administration of Fisheye considerably.

fields.description:
Fisheye can only limit its queries to perforce based on the path set in SCM details.  Some users have multiple repositories pointing to the same root path, and then limit which subpaths should be indexed using include paths.  Unfortunately with this configuration, fisheye still has to query large amounts of data from perforce.

For example, say a user had these roots in their perforce repository
/a/ - 100 commits
/b/ - 100 commits
/c/ -100,000 commits

If a user wanted a fisheye repository to include /a/ and /b/ but exclude /c/, they would have to create a repository pointing to / and include /a/ and /b/, excluding /c/.  This would mean that fisheye still had to request and process all the commits in /c/.  This can be a huge performance problem, especially if the user has multiple groups they need to include like this.
fields.summary: Limit queries to perforce so that changelists that do not contain relevant changes are not requested

fields.description:
Branches & Labels are global concepts in P4, but we treat them as per-repo, with each P4Scanner instance expensively querying the corresponding P4 tables, even if we have multiple FishEye repos pointing to the same P4 server (which is common). This causes considerable performance impact on P4 servers, because these tables are read-locked by FishEye. For example, see:

http://kb.perforce.com/article/1801/how-to-stop-performance-problems-due-to-fisheye-scanning-labels

Introduce the concept of a P4 Server that is shared between all FishEye repos that point to the same P4 URL. The server construct should cache results of querying the various global P4 tables. First cab off the rank would be the branches table. Branch update times could also be cached, with a TTL expiry. 

There are some details that need to be fleshed out before commencing this work; namely, what to do about FishEye repos that share a server, but have other different configurations.
fields.summary: Implement the concept of a P4 Server

With mail attribute set correctly in LDAP and configured in Fisheye, the following warning is being reported in the logs:
{noformat}

{noformat}
everytime a sync is triggered.
There is no reason for the warning as the email addresses are being fetched as expected from LDAP. 

h3. Workaround

Removing this attribute from Fisheye config fixes the issue.

fields.description:
Quick Search does not perform substring search on the file content eg: searching for 'getDebug' in Quick Search will not get any result for the file with the content 'getDebugStatus'.
Need wildcard for Quick Search eg: searching for 'getDebug*' will get result for the file with content 'getDebugStatus'.

EQL content query does not support '=~' clause. Need '=~' to perform substring search on file content
fields.summary: Add wildcard to Quick Search or '=~' to EQL content search

fields.description: The Block size allows whole positive numbers, but the error message upon entering an invalid value is "Block Size must be a positive number". It does not accept a 0 or a positive decimal either. In that case, I think the message should be "Block Size must be a positive whole/natural number".
fields.summary: Block size check messaging incorrect
Provide ability to filter out Mercurial closed branches in Commit Graph

fields.description: Some customers use Speakeasy, and it would be nice to be able to integrate it with FishEye natively, as it's currently a [third-party plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.speakeasy-plugin].
fields.summary: Make FishEye compatible with Speakeasy
Update error message if FishEye server is not whitelisted

fields.description:
When the repository admin dialog is loaded by clicking on one of the repository names in the admin repo list, it is possible for a repository state refresh message to be received by the browser before the repository state has been loaded. This results in excpetions being shown, although the repository admin dialog does successfully load.

We need to ignore state update messages received before the dialog is fully initialised.
fields.summary: Slow response to getFullRepositoryInfo causes GWT exceptions when loading repository admin dialog

fields.description:
"Diffs to ... from revision" feature does not seem to work.  This feature is there at the point of adding content to a review, and we assumed it meant you can specify a particular base revision to diff to when adding files.

Our use case is generally code reviewing an entire development branch. Normally the add as "Diffs" works, but we've found crucible gets confused if the branch contains a merge from default in it as it thinks the branch contains the default chanegs that have been merged in. We thought the "Diffs to ..." feature would allow us to work round this by diffing to the last revision in default that the branch contains.
But when we try and do this we get an error like this:

{noformat}
Error
Server Error

Error 2
A java.lang.NullPointerException was encountered

Couln't find this revision with key src/main/java/com/ocado/atlas/inbound/business/AtlasPriority.java@9364fb16f1a4f5f4f8c33f51a259bfdce1b8d155 in repository CFC_InboundAtlasManager
{noformat}

How it is supposed to work:

- for every file that you add, instead of just adding that revision with the "diff to previous" (default behaviour), it will diff to the revision that you specified.

eg. say you have revisions 1, 3, 5, 10. If you add 10 normally, you will get a diff of 5-10. If you add 10 as "Diff to ..." 3, you will get a diff of 3-10.

What I would expect it to do if you chose "Diff to ..." 4, you will get a diff of 3-10. That is, the manifest version of the file at revision 4. This is where the NPE is occurring, and I have confirmed that this is a bug.
fields.summary: "Diffs to ... from revision" feature does not work

fields.description: Using "Removed Text" to search in Fisheye works in Standard Search but switching to EyeQL creates an incorrect query using "deletedLine" rather than "removedLine".
fields.summary: Switching from simple to eyeQL search can create a broken eyeQL query

fields.description:
If you have 2 SVN repositories with changesets 1-10, and you rescan revisions 7-9 on repo1, the changesets 7-9 will be removed from the activity stream in repo2.

This affects the activity streams and the JIRA source tab.
fields.summary: Rescanning SVN changesets causes the same changeset ids to disappear from other repositories

fields.description: If a merge is edited before being committed, the Files list in the log associated with the changeset only shows the manually edited files, not the full listing.  All of the files merged in the changeset are visible using log --debug, but it appears that however it is that Fisheye is extracting only the shallow file list.
fields.summary: Fisheye indexing misses files on merge commit

fields.description:
From https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+upgrade+guide, method 2, step 5 and 6 :

5. Delete the <New FishEye home directory>/var and <New FishEye home directory>/cache directories.
6. Copy (or move) the <FishEye home directory>/var directory to <New FishEye home directory>/var.

instead of the whole <FishEye home directory>/var directory, it should only be :

<FishEye home directory>/var/cache
<FishEye home directory>/var/data
<FishEye home directory>/var/log

Do not copy:

<FishEye home directory>/var/osgi-cache
<FishEye home directory>/var/plugins
<FishEye home directory>/var/tmp

because it will cause FishEye to fail starting silently!
fields.summary: Documentation: Update the Upgrade guide

fields.description:
LightSCM support has long been deprecated but the application continues to ship with these as bundled plugins.
These plugins should be removed as they are no longer supported/recommended.
fields.summary: LightSCM plugins still being bundled with Fisheye/Crucible after being deprecated

fields.description:
FishEye admin may decide to index only subset of SVN repository only, by providing "Start Revision" setting on repository admin screen. It is expected that this would reduce indexing time, but in some circumstances it may not happen. Basically when Start Revision setting was set, FishEye would start from checking out the whole repository at a given revision.  If repository is large, contains several (million) paths and several branches this might be a costly operation leading to OutOfMemoryError and being unable to finish.

Perhaps it could defer checking out the content to the later indexing stages, retrieve manifest earlier on and finish initial pump quickly?

fields.description:
I have two JIRA issues, let's say TST-1 and TST-2, both in Open state.

I'm committing some code using the smart commit below:
{noformat}
svn commit -m "TST-1 [Replicant of TST-2 for AB1.2] - <testing> this AB123 test 1.2.03 to 1.3.03 ABC-DE just a text #comment testing this AB2 to AB1.2 #resolve +review CR @fkraemer"
{noformat}

Although the smart commit is executed, it's not working as expected.
The expected behaviour is to close TST-1 as resolved because it was the first JIRA issue key mentioned in the smart commit, but it's currently resolving TST-2.
fields.summary: Smart Commits: Problem when multiple JIRA issue keys are mentioned

fields.description:
If there's a file and folder at the same level in a Git repository that have the same name, and the file is removed, Fisheye also appears to index the directory as having been removed.

We had the following in the root of one of our Git repos:
./cookbooks/ (Dir)
./cookbooks  (File)

At one point, the file was removed, but now it appears that cookbooks folder is marked by Fisheye as having been removed also, even though it wasn't deleted. We have to enabled the "show deleted file and folders" to be able to to see the directory.

We're running Fisheye 3.0.2, and I re-created the repo from scratch to ensure that the issue wasn't an artifact of upgrading from the 2.x Fisheye series.

To the best of my knowledge, we didn't see this issue with 2.x, even though the deletion occurred during that time.
fields.summary: Git: Fisheye removes references to both files and directories at the same level if either has been removed

fields.description: On application running behind reverse proxy with Site URL setting left empty, avatar images, displayed next to user name in People section (top menu), have server name "localhost.localdomain" instead of correct hostname used by other Avatar images.
fields.summary: Avatar images in People menu have incorrect URL

fields.description:
Currently, the test resources that are used in AMPS FeCru plugin contain only one "admin" user.

This is unlikely an ideal initial set up for most plugin developers.

I would propose to make the following changes to the test resources:
* add a new 'sysadmin' user that has system administrator permission
* add a new non-admin user 'joe' or 'fred'.
* if FeCru is ever going to do the sysadmin/admin split, change the 'admin' user to have only admin rights.

Ideally the changes mentioned above are the same across all product's test resources to make it easier to write tests for cross-product plugin.
fields.summary: Generate more test data in test resources
FishEye present errors when using path with spaces on windows.

fields.description:
We have a load-balancing device in front of our Fisheye instance that acts as our primary compression device. Compression is rule-based, and we use mime-types to determine whether responses are compressed or not.

Fisheye appears to be sending some content without a mime-type which bypasses our compression rules, so we'd like to have Fisheye set the mime-type in the future releases.

Specifically, the requests that return responses without a mime-type are those that generate the imagemap data for the commit activity and line history:

/fe/commitSparkline.do
/fe/commitChartDay
/fe/commitChartHour
/fe/locChart.do

, where the outputtype parameter is imagemap for each of the above
fields.summary: Fisheye sparklines/loc charts have no imagemap data mime-type set

fields.description: When a constraint exists which shows only part of a repository (e.g. when viewing a user's activity) exclusions of changset comments from other repositories (because they are disabled, or because the current user doesn't have permission) are not applied.
fields.summary: Changeset comments appear in activity stream even when the user does not have permission to see that repository, or the repository is disabled

fields.description:
All commit "watch" emails from FishEye use "UserName - Committed" as the sender name, as opposed to just "UserName". We would like to customize this or be able to remove it entirely, but according to Atlassian support this is currently hard-coded. It was requested that we file a feature request.

For reference, see this thread:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/194897/why-is-fisheye-email-sender-username-committed-instead-of-username?page=1#195321
fields.summary: Remove "- Committed" suffix on commit email sender names

fields.description:
We have a fisheye instance which indexes 2 bigger svn-repositories. After some bigger changes in svn (which produced several thousand changesets which each did just change the content of a pom.xml) we noticed a very bad performance. It needed about a week to update the index.

When analysing the problem I came to the suspicion that there is a no parallelizing/MP-Support and some synchronization issues.

I attached three graphs from our monitoring system:

Memory:
Memory: Fisheye has a maxMem of 3.5GB - only 3 GB are used on the system so memory is not the problem

CPU:
The box has 2 cpu. The graph is showing a utilization of near 50% (one CPU is in use and the other is idleing). Most is used on user-space - there is no real IOWait (so the network or svn itself is not the problem)

ContextSwitches:
There is a really big amount of ContextSwitches which leads me to the conclusion that there are synchronization issues in the code


As a workaround we moved the fisheye instance onto the subversion server and are now using the file-protocol. This sppeds up the indexing to a subjective normal value. As currently said subversion itself is not the problem (we would hav IOWait issues) so I assume that the problem (or at least the trigger) should be around the http-access to svn

I would suggest to analyze the code an do some optimization at this point. 
Additionally I would suggest to improve the multiprocessing-support at this point.
fields.summary: Locking issues on scanning/indexing a svn-repository via http

fields.description:
This is useful for customers that use [Commit Hooks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+commit+hooks] to trigger incremental repository polling and have thousands of repositories.
Ideally, when the first incremental indexing is triggered by a hook the polling at the repository level would be disabled automatically and a global setting for repositories where the indexing is triggered by a hook would be applied.
fields.summary: Allow disabling repository polling using the REST API or a global setting

fields.description:
Fisheye initial indexing seems to struggle while generating a large svn diff.
There is a configurable filesize limit for indexing but this does not apply to diffs.
It would help to have a configurable property to define a limit on the size of diffs generated during initial indexing.
fields.summary: Have a configurable size limit on SVN Diff

fields.description:
Once config.xml contains many plugin properties, getting plugin properties becomes a bottleneck, with many threads waiting for access.

We need to cache the properties or move them to the relational DB (or both).
fields.summary: Large number of plugin properties harm performance

fields.description: As an administrator it would be very useful if I could add a Stash _Project_  to Fisheye, and all repositories in that project would be added as Fisheye repos. I'd also like an option to make it a one-time add or automatically add/remove repos as the Stash project changes. This feature would cut down on my administrative time in FishEye and allow users to help themselves. It would also put more of our source into FishEye, making FishEye more valuable to us.
fields.summary: Integrate with Bitbucket Server repositories & projects
Truststore Is Mandatory When Setting Up FishEye/Crucible With SSL

fields.description:
If a repository is added into FishEye/Crucible with more than 80 characters, it's commits can't be added into a review:
{noformat}
2013-07-22 17:56:13,992 WARN  [qtp650484437-1332 ] org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler ServletHandler-doHandle - /cru/CR-1/edit-changelog/
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The value 'testtesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttesttest' for the property 'defaultSource' is too long. It should have a maximum length of 80
	at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.PropertyLengthCheckerListener.checkEntity(PropertyLengthCheckerListener.java:25)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.PropertyLengthCheckerListener.onFlushDirty(PropertyLengthCheckerListener.java:12)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.HibernateListenerInterceptor.onFlushDirty(HibernateListenerInterceptor.java:34)
	at org.hibernate.event.def.DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.invokeInterceptor(DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.java:372)
	at org.hibernate.event.def.DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.handleInterception(DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.java:349)
	at org.hibernate.event.def.DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.scheduleUpdate(DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.java:287)
	at org.hibernate.event.def.DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.onFlushEntity(DefaultFlushEntityEventListener.java:155)
{noformat}

FishEye/Crucible should have checked and limit the repository name when it is added into the server.
fields.summary: Repository name more than 80 characters can't be added to review

fields.description:
Dear Support Team,

first of all our problem is not related to any loss but it's still critical: we configured some Git repos to our Fisheye 3 weeks ago. The connection is OK, the keys are placed correctly. 
The problem is that all the repositories are still scanning however these are very small repos. 
We get these message for all repos: The repository 'ZYBF' is being scanned, information from the repository may not be up to date.

Can you please help us investigating the problem?

Many thanks in advance!
Best Regards,
Tamas
fields.summary: Git repositories are still scanning since weeks
